career.description: Together with the team at Techland, we're implementing online features for AAA games. My work revolves around integrating their custom engine with partners' SDKs (Steam, Epic Online Services, PlayStation Network, Xbox Live, etc.) and leading the design and development of the team's core C++ libraries.

Finibit is a company I set up with my friend as a side business years ago. We're building custom web apps in Node.js and React. Depending on the circumstances, I enjoy being a CEO, CTO, CFO, or software developer.

I authored and conducted classes on building web apps for Microsoft Azure. The curriculum was designed to teach students the basics of VMs, storage options, databases, and deployment strategies for static websites and web apps.
I started as a C++ programmer writing core services for DECT devices. I later moved to develop the web admin interface for those devices.
I was writing software for base stations according to the specification and prototyping cloud solutions for the next generation of hardware.
I was porting PC games to Nintendo DS and 3DS consoles and leading the development of a proprietary 2D game engine for Nintendo 3DS.
I developed three casual games for PC. I was responsible for production, design, gameplay programming, and leading a team of graphic and sound artists.

skills.name: C++ programming
skills.summary: It's my bread and butter. I've read many books and have written all kinds of software with it. I occasionally read the C++ standard to remind myself how little I know about the language. I rate myself 2 out of 10 with a plan to become 4 by the end of my career.

skills.name: Game development
skills.summary: I've been building game engines professionally and as a hobby since I remember. I don't know much about rendering or physics, as I'm more interested in architecture, networking, online services, file systems, and other stuff that often goes unnoticed.

skills.name: JavaScript programming
skills.summary: I'm partial to suboptimally designed languages... Nevertheless, I use JavaScript for web development, building tools, and scripting. Knowing it makes me more sympathetic of C++, and allows me to approach problems from different perspective.

skills.name: Web development
skills.summary: I've been building full-stack apps for a few years now. I primarily use Node.js, React.js, and Tailwind CSS. I recently started appreciating Next.js. I'm well-versed in various concepts like server-side rendering, CSS-in-JS, bundlers, asset optimization, etc.

projects.name: Untypical
projects.description: The source code of my personal website.

projects.name: Goodies
projects.description: A collection of useful tools for JavaScript.
